Problematic assumption: The claim makes a wild assumption that Bill Gates' father "ran" Planned Parenthood and taught his son to spread the "gospel of eugenics" without providing any evidence to support it.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence to support the assertion that Bill Gates' father supported the idea of eugenics.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that Bill Gates' father, William Gates Sr., worked on the board of Planned Parenthood along with other charities, but there is no evidence to suggest that he "ran" the organization.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the role and influence of Bill Gates' father in Planned Parenthood by suggesting that he taught his son to spread the "gospel of eugenics," which is not supported by any evidence.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim fails to consider alternative explanations for Bill Gates' philanthropic activities on the Planned Parenthood board and instead jumps to the assumption of eugenics involvement.
